items.title: RBI cuts policy rate by 25 bps
items.summary: The Reserve Bank of India cut its policy interest rate by a quarter-point, citing a 'Goldilocks' economy with low inflation and strong growth. The central bank also injected liquidity to ensure rate cuts reach consumers and addressed currency market movements. Inflation forecasts were lowered, and growth targets were raised.

items.title: Quick commerce fuels 40% surge in sexual wellness sales with discreet 10-minute delivery
items.summary: Sexual wellness product sales surged on quick commerce platforms, nearly doubling the growth rate of offline trade. Discreet purchases and rapid 10-minute deliveries are driving this trend, with manufacturers developing specific products for these channels. This shift offers convenience, privacy, and wider variety, particularly for younger consumers.

items.title: IndiGo meltdown triggers over 1,000 cancellations; government steps in
items.summary: IndiGo cancelled over 1,000 flights on Friday, disrupting travel plans nationwide. The civil aviation regulator is stepping in to help operate flights. IndiGo's CEO acknowledged the disruption and promised improvements. The crisis stems from new pilot rest rules and inadequate preparations by the airline. Passengers faced long waits and cancelled journeys during a busy travel season.

items.title: Rate cut signals RBI’s pivot to growth amid sharp inflation slowdown
items.summary: With GDP growth at 8% and CPI inflation at 2.2%, the RBI cut the repo rate by 25 bps to stimulate the economy. The central bank's actions, including liquidity measures, aim to support growth amid US tariff-related headwinds.

items.title: Mahindra Logistics locks 3.28 lakh sq ft lease in Telangana — a strategic bet on logistics expansion

Recent leases in Telangana, Pune, the Northeast, and near Kolkata highlight the company's push into Tier-II and Tier-III markets to meet rising supply chain demands across India.

items.title: Brookfield India REIT raises Rs 3,500 cr through QIP
items.summary: Brookfield India REIT has successfully raised Rs 3,500 crore through a qualified institutional placement. This capital will partly finance the REIT's acquisition of Ecoworld, a significant office campus in Bengaluru. The deal marks the largest REIT acquisition in India. The placement saw strong subscription from both domestic and global investors, including major financial institutions.

items.title: RBI asks partner banks to halt issuing OneCard credit cards
items.summary: FPL Technologies finds itself in a tough spot. The Reserve Bank of India has mandated partner banks to stop issuing OneCard credit cards. This pause is due to the RBI's desire to ensure transparency regarding data-sharing practices in this collaboration. The issuance will kick back into gear once guidelines are established.

items.title: Indigo, an airline big enough to make a bigger impact
items.summary: IndiGo's dominance in Indian aviation has caused significant passenger disruptions.  Thousands faced travel chaos during peak seasons.  Airport operations were impacted, with one airport temporarily shut.  This situation highlights the risks of a single dominant carrier.  Calls for fair competition and easing foreign airline entry are growing.  India's aviation landscape has seen multiple airline collapses.

items.title: Operations expected to normalise soon: IndiGo CEO Pieter Elbers
items.summary: IndiGo CEO Pieter Elbers has apologized for over a thousand flight cancellations. Crew shortages and safety rules caused the disruptions. Operations are expected to stabilize between December 10 and 15. The airline is focusing on passenger communication, clearing stranded travelers, and realigning resources for a stable Saturday schedule. The situation worsened after a system reboot.

items.title: Aviation Ministry orders probe into IndiGo crisis; eases duty time rules for airline
items.summary: IndiGo flights are expected to stabilize by Saturday and return to normal within three days. The Civil Aviation Minister has ordered a high-level probe into recent disruptions. Urgent measures are being taken to assist passengers. Flight duty time limitations for IndiGo have been temporarily suspended to improve crew availability and restore schedules.

items.title: India, Russia deepen civil nuclear ties for power and beyond
items.summary: India and Russia are boosting nuclear energy ties. They will cooperate on the fuel cycle and support the Kudankulam plant. New advanced nuclear technologies are also on the agenda. Discussions will accelerate on Russian-designed reactors and joint manufacturing. Fuel for Kudankulam Units 3 and 4 has begun delivery. This marks a significant step in India's nuclear expansion plans.

items.title: Russia eyes bigger fertiliser play, calls for duty cut
items.summary: Russia has ramped up its fertilizer exports to India, now commanding a staggering 26% of the subcontinent’s fertilizer imports. This surge contributes significantly to an economic alliance, with Russian fertilizers increasingly finding their place in BRICS nations. S

items.title: RBI to launch two-month drive to clear long-pending ombudsman complaints
items.summary: The Reserve Bank of India will launch a two-month campaign in January to resolve all customer grievances pending for over a month with the RBI Ombudsman. Governor Sanjay Malhotra urged banks to address complaints promptly, noting a rise in pendency due to increased grievance numbers. The central bank is also strengthening customer service through various initiatives and online application availability.

items.title: RBI Governor expects deposit rates to ease but that may not be easy
items.summary: RBI Governor Sanjay Malhotra anticipates deposit rates will moderate, mirroring the central bank's 125 basis point policy rate reduction. He noted that real interest rates remain high despite nominal rate decreases, benefiting both borrowers and savers. Data shows a 105 basis point decline in weighted average domestic term deposit rates, though bankers suggest further reductions are limited.

items.title: Govt plans RRB listings in FY27, two banks to debut
items.summary: State-run banks are preparing for the stock market debut of their sponsored regional rural banks. At least two such banks are expected to list in the first half of FY27. This move follows a consolidation exercise that reduced the number of regional rural banks. Eligible banks will meet specific financial criteria.

items.title: Abbott asks stockists to buy only from authorised suppliers
items.summary: Spurious medicines were seized in Puducherry, prompting drug maker Abbott Healthcare to warn stockists. They must buy only from authorized suppliers. The government alerted the Drug Controller General of India about the circulation of fake drugs. The All India Organisation of Chemists and Druggists issued an advisory for safe business practices. This is a serious trade alert.

items.title: Home, auto loans may cost even less with RBI's nudge

items.title: Share Market Highlights: Markets end marginally higher; Sensex closes at 85,265, Nifty at 26,034
items.summary:
Sensex, Nifty updates on 4 December 2025: Benchmark indices ended slightly higher on Thursday as investors stayed on the sidelines ahead of the Reserve Bank of India’s monetary policy outcome on Friday. The Sensex rose 158.51 points to close at ₹85,265.32, while the Nifty gained 47.75 points to end at 26,033.75.

Market breadth remained weak with 1,817 stocks advancing, 2,303 declining, and 182 remaining unchanged out of 4,302 traded. As many as 80 stocks hit 52-week highs, while 261 touched new lows. 157 stocks were locked in upper circuit, whereas **211 slipped into lower circuit.

items.title: Cautiously optimistic on India; eyeing earnings revival: Sanger
items.summary: Global liquidity tailwinds are unlikely to get any better from now and that makes Arvind Sanger, Managing Partner at Geosphere Capital Management “cautiously optimistic” on the Indian markets.

items.title: Automation threatens 69% jobs in India: World Bank
items.summary: "In large parts of Africa, it is likely that technology could fundamentally disrupt this pattern. Research based on World Bank data has predicted that the proportion of jobs threatened in India by automation is 69 percent, in China it is 77 percent and in Ethiopia, the percentage of jobs threatened by automation is 85 percent," he said.
